intro: Endymion cernuus, commonly known as the drooping evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Endymion cernuus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
